title: James Dolan Reportedly Bans Charles Oakley From MSG for Life and Fans Are Pissed
text:
Knicks Fans Should Boycott the Team Until James Dolan Sells Per Bontemps, Doland then said Oakley has an "anger" problem, and may or may not also have an "alcohol" problem: 
James Dolan says Charles has a "problem with anger" and then he also says "he may have a problem with alcohol, we don't know." — Tim Bontemps (@TimBontemps) February 10, 2017 Dolan added Oakley would have to address these issues before being allowed back: 
Dolan says nothing would make him happier than having Oakley honored at at MSG. Says Oak needs to address his behaviors to make that happen — Ian Begley (@IanBegley) February 10, 2017 Furthermore, Dolan said Oakley's past contributions to the team (he played there from 1988-98) didn't excuse his behavior on Wednesday night: 
"I understand that he was a big star, but that doesn't excuse people from that type of behavior." -James Dolan on Oakley ban from MSG — The Michael Kay Show (@TMKSESPN) February 10, 2017 Dolan also said Oakley's abuse of staff had racial and sexual overtones: 
Now Dolan just said Oakley's abuse of MSG staff had racial and sexual overtones. — Yaya Dubin (@JADubin5) February 10, 2017 According to TMZ Sports , witness statements included a number of allegations, like Oakley calling a security guard a "rat bastard" who was "sucking on Dolan's dick." After that was when the physical altercation began. Oakley then told Phil Jackson, in one of MSG's tunnels, "You didn't want to listen to me before so don't talk to me now." According to a manager, Oakley then said, "All you whites over there get your story straight, why don't you have some brothers over there with you? Fuck all you white boys." As well as, "Fuck you police, I used to respect you but now I don't have no respect for you motherfuckers." He then continued to repeat that they all "just suck Dolan's dick." It's worth noting that all of those statements came from the Knicks' staff. For his part, Oakley said , "What happened is me and four friends went to the game tonight, to watch the Knicks and Clippers. We did sit down, trying to have a good time. Next thing I know I was asked to leave the building. "I asked, 'Why?' and they said, 'You have to leave because someone ordered you to leave.' And I'm like, 'I've been here four and a half minutes.'" The Knicks have said they will send out a "follow-up video" of the incident later on Friday: 
Garden also indicates that "follow-up video" will be distributed later today. Very curious to see what it shows. — Howard Beck (@HowardBeck) February 10, 2017 This whole thing is a freakin' mess, and it's not lost on fans and pundits. 
Let's play along with the Knicks. Charles Oakley had one very bad day. Great. It happens. Now, Mr. Dolan can you explain the last 16 years. — Frank Isola (@FisolaNYDN) February 10, 2017 
For James Dolan, after the Isiah Thomas debacle, to be shaming OAKLEY for sexism and racism, without any evidence, is unconscionable. — Alexander Goot (@AGoot18) February 10, 2017 
Holy hell!!!! Pl ase someone have one of these townhall meetings with James Dolan. I don't think he's surrounded by many truth tellers. — Michelle Beadle (@MichelleDBeadle) February 10, 2017 
James Dolan is the equivalent to woody johnson of the nfl. I'll trade charles oakley for dolan and roll the dice any day #knicks
